page.title: 12The Town Dump
page.content: While we were surveying our D-block, we passed a disused quarry. Nowadays it is used for waste disposal. All the rubbish from Witney and other towns is taken here and it is dumped. The pits are then covered over. Unfortunately, the dump is now full and another will have to be found. When I was at North Leigh I visited the quarry and it was full to the top. There was a great, big, yellow, mechanical digger and it cruched a washing machine and it was flattened first time. If you drop rubbish around the quarry you will be fined four pounds. It is closing at the end of this month (June 1985) and the dump is moving to Stanton Harcourt. The quarry will turn into a field in time. by Nicola Baker
